inn1.comm: starts with a dot ball, full outside off, Amla solidly forward and blocks back to the bowler
full outside off, offers to shape away from Amla, defended square into the off side
across onto off stump, defended into the covers
full outside off, left alone, good carry through to Ramdin
short of a length at the body, tucked into the leg side wide of midwicket to get the innings underway
full outside off, defended back to the bowler...good opening over
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, angled down the leg side, called wide
adjusts back to being full outside off, left alone
short of a length, pushed down the leg side again...half an appeal for something but the umpire decides it hasn't touched anything
outside off, through to the keeper
flicked off around off stump, down to long leg
short of a length outside off, driven at the top of the bounce to point
beats him this time, 130kph, it was short of a length again and this really climbed off the pitch to fly over the top edge as Rossouw tried to play square
back of a length on off stump, punched from the back foot to cover
in the air, but lobbed wide mid-on...Amla trying to work this from around off stump to the leg side. It bounces and takes the splice of the bat
round the wicket, outside off, pushed into the covers
cleaned up! Stumps are demolished as Taylor plays all round a full delivery which is angled in from around the wicket, some late swing as well, and no footwork from Rossouw. Another duck for him
good delivery, very full at the stumps, straightens on du Plessis and he's squared up, getting a leading edge towards mid-off but along the ground
back of a length outside off, 144kph, this one nips back off the seam as du Plessis shoulders arms...skids through to Ramdin. Lively stuff.
full on off stump, 131kph, Amla drives and it squirts off a thick inside edge to midwicket
a shorter delivery, angled into the hip area, deflects off inside edge and the thigh pad towards square leg
a bouncer, 125kph, rather loopy and it's too short
full outside off, left alone
a touch wider, 131kph, du Plessis not interested and he thought it should have been a wide
short of a length on off stump, worked to square leg
that's a fantastic stroke, it wasn't a half volley, it came forward into a full ball then drove on the up straight of mid-off
this isn't as convincing, Taylor keeps it full encourages another drive which takes a thick edge wide of second slip
gets across outside off and pushes towards mid-on
short of a length, punched off the back foot into the covers and splits the difference between the fielders

and another! Full, straight, du Plessis playing across the line and given. There was a brief chat about using the review, but he decides against it. Good variation from Taylor, this one dipping in late, and it actually took the back pad so didn't have far to travel

and it's edged wide of second slip! Probably wouldn't have carried to third, but it's excellent bowling from Taylor as he keeps it full outside off, de Villiers is pushing forward away from his body as the ball swings
inside edge on this length delivery which deflects into his pads and bobbles down by his feet
back of a length outside off, defended square into the covers
takes advantage of some width, stands tall and cuts this in front of square through the off side...a poor delivery
angled down the leg side, glances the pad and deflects fine of the diving keep...after the width outside off he over-corrected
throws his hands at this one, full outside off, he goes in the air square through the off side. He wasn't in control but it went dead square rather than backward point or cover
drags the length back, nips into Amla, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, 145kph, the pace is very good, left alone
comes nicely forward and drives to cover
drives to mid-off
a yorker, he jabs down and keeps it down
slips out as a low full toss and clipped wide of mid-on
full again at the stumps, punched up to mid-off
angled down to third man
back of a length outside off, goes onto the back foot and plays to cover
there's the use Amla's wrist, as he fetches this from outside off and clips it to the right of mid-on
loses his line again down the leg side and that's an easy one for him to clip away fine...the run rate on the rise now
back outside off, 124kph, he comes forward and defends
back of a length at off stump, 130kph, de Villiers plays it back down the pitch
back of length, whipped away through square leg with a lovely piece of timing
flicked into the square-leg area again, the man has gone deep so there's a jogged single
opens the face and runs them down to third man
nudged away from off stump, opens the face square into the off side...well-judged single
well bowled! Painful for de Villiers. Extra bounce from back of a length, jags back at him and hammers into the bottom hand as he defends awkwardly
shorter and wide outside off, chopped into the covers
mistimed from Amla as he goes onto the back foot to a shorter ball, rolls into the leg side
appeal for lbw, it nipped back quite a long way but struck him high on the pad...would have gone well over
that's a cracker, dispatches a full, straight delivery with a crack of the wrists through midwicket. That raced to the boundary
gets across onto off stump works a length delivery wide of mid on
now it's AB's turn, lovely batting. He comes forward to a floaty, full ball and drives it elegantly down the on side of the stumps
full on off stump, blocked to the off side
back of a length outside off, left alone, bounces quite a lot that
touch fuller and straighter, driven off the back foot to extra-cover
much straighter, worked down to long leg, fielder quickly across to his left saving the second
fuller, on off stump, played forward back to the bowler
foot outside off, delicately dabbed fine of third man and they run well for a second
slightly tighter line, de Villiers rather hangs the bat out to it and gets beaten, nice end to the over for the bowler
full length just outside off, Amla across his stumps to dab towards midwicket, they try a quick single and had Holder gathered running in he might have had a run-out chance at the bowler's end
good length, wobbles away a little and de Villiers beaten trying to run it down fine
slides down the leg side, comes off the keeper's pad for an extra extra
straight line, tickled down to long leg
line back on off stump, this is blocked back up the wicket
touch further outside off, nudged up to extra-cover
little straight again and tucked down to long leg
decent length on off stump, delicate dabbed wide of backward point for a quick single
bumper, drifts down leg, extras totting up here
better length, middle and off line, defended up the wicket
bumper, better line this time, hooked at and missed, it really gets up and flies over the keeper, beat the batsman for pace though
back on a length but well outside off and easily guided down to third man
fuller and straighter, clipped out into the deep through the leg side
on the stumps again, whipped wide of deep midwicket and they come back for an easy second
full and straight, tucked through square leg
slips down leg and with the keeper stood back he's got no chance, poor ball
just outside off, de Villiers waits until the last moment before angling down to third man
back of a length, Amla back punching down to long-on
drifts down leg again and this is clipped wide enough of long leg for a second
fuller and off stump enough to just defend up the wicket
length a good two feet wide of off stump, cut without timing to extra-cover
wider line and this time Amla nails the cut wide of the cover sweeper, great shot, fast hands through the ball
fuller but now too straight and an easy tuck out to deep midwicket
too straight once more, easy nudge through square leg once more
back of a length at the body, dropped down off his toes into square leg and a quick single brings up a half-century in 49 balls
back of a length again, this more off stump, dropped into the off side now but no run available
full length just outside off, Amla forward knocking it into the covers
just back of a good length around off, punched hanging back to extra-cover
straighter line, touch fuller, flicked out to deep square
back of a length, waited for over off stump and knocked down to third man
fuller, strikes the pad but would have slid down after Amla missed looking to flick to leg
bit of extra bounce just outside off, guided carefully to third man
left arm around, tossed onto off stump, carefully knocked into the cover
little straighter, Amla across his stumps to knock a single short into square leg
good length just outside off and it turns past the outside edge with de Villiers trying to drive through cover
touch shorter and de Villiers is back to cut to deep point
much fuller, dug out back to the bowler
wider and shorter, cut at a little loosely and it flies off a thick outside edge but well wide of slip and it races away to the fence to ruin Benn's over
good length, forward is de Villiers knocking this back to the bowler
fuller, a slightly airy drive brings a thick inside edge to mid-on
good length on the stumps, driven to the right of the bowler and they get an easy single inside mid-on
back of a length a foot outside off, flicked to backward point
wider line and fuller, flashed away through the covers, beating the sweeper, timed it so well
not quite as wide, pressed steadily out to the sweeper
full length, pressed into the covers for an easy single
not quite as full, de Villiers tries to work off side but finds point
straighter line and whipped down to long-on
tad shorter, batsman right back punching down to long-on
flatter ball but a little straight so easily dabbed through square leg
good length on the off stump, just knocked back to the bowler
full at the off stump, knocked straight back to the bowler

wide line, slapped wide of third man and they charge back for the second but the fielding is excellent and the throw right over the bails from Andre Russell and Amla is short of his ground! What a bonus for West Indies. This pair in absolutely no trouble at all. Amla has rather greedily gone for the second and has been done by some superb fielding. Russell sharply to his right and the throw was perfect, Ramdin didn't have to move to take it, whipped off the bails and Amla was a couple of inches short
full length just outside off, driven very nicely but straight to mid-off but Benn lets it run straight through him! Whoops
similar area, this is just blocked into the off side
waited for this in the crease and angled to backward point
touch wider line and now left
he's forward and defends
drifts onto the pads and is worked behind square
gently driven down the ground to long off
gets right across outside off and tucks this behind square on the leg side
angled into leg stump from round the wicket, pushed back down the pitch
runs off an open face to short third man, Miller came racing up for a single but was quickly sent back
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended back to Taylor
gets forward outside off and defends to mid off
excellent delivery, speared in full, Miller digs it out
now he hits him with a short delivery, very good aggression from Taylor, coming with the angle from round the wicket and Miller is fending at it with his hands in front of his face
ah, what a response from Miller! Ball after getting a whack he slots a perfect cover drive away, but Taylor will be frustrated he allowed him the ball to hit
and another drive! Miller ends up winning the over. Another full ball, in the slot, and this time Miller drives it straight of mid-off
steps back to a shorter delivery and cuts towards short third man
he's again working a delivery from outside off into the leg side, with the turn
opens his stance a touch and then drives down to long off
there's some spin this time, takes Miller high on the pad as he tried to work to leg
picks out square leg this time
uses his feet and then ends up defending as Benn drags his length back at the last moment
more good timing from de Villiers as he works a straight delivery wide of mid on
137kph, defended back to the bowler
short of a length, tucked off the pads into square leg
round the wicket, back of a length, played off the back foot
neatly flicked from outside off through midwicket
full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
comes down on the line of leg stump then pushed into the off side
full outside off, driven powerfully out to the cover sweeper
deposited over the rope, nice clean strike by Miller as he used his feet then picked this up from outside off and lofted it over long on despite the fielder being on the fence
now he works this through midwicket, along the floor, and placed wide of the sweeper
tucked into midwicket, Gayle chugs after it and there would have been a single there
worked to square leg
tucked out to deep midwicket
full outside off, 121kph, driven up to mid off
width outside off and that's an invitation to go hard at the ball, he drives and it goes more behind square than he would have wanted but finds a gap between backward point and short third man
responds with a slower ball, 104kph, and it grips on the pitch to take a leading edge back towards Sammy
direct hit from Gayle at mid off, but Miller is safely home after setting off quickly for the single after he played the drive. Was on the front foot, which helped
a loopy slower ball, 91kph, which is bunted to long on
lovely delivery! Turn and bounce to beat the outside edge as de Villiers looks to push it down the ground.
and now he nearly over-balances out of the crease as he's beaten again, playing the cut this time, and has to make sure his back foot doesn't drag out
driven down to long on
slips this down the leg side
tucks this into midwicket where Gayle just waits for the ball to arrive at his feet
played into the leg side
goes back in the crease and dabs to short third man, went too quickly for the single
round the wicket, starts with a full delivery which is punched down the ground
what a stroke, more fantastic timing and placement from de Villiers as he drives a full delivery between cover and mid-off...a little, late opening of the face helped thread the gap
flick just to the right of midwicket who can't stop the single
beats the edge with a full one as he goes for the drive
goes for another yorker, jabbed into the leg side
nudges a length delivery to midwicket and that's another fifty for de Villiers, from 61 balls
opens the face towards third man
pushed across outside off, glides this away to third man
stands on leg stump, the ball angles into him but he is still able to guide it to third man
a short delivery, Miller rolls his wrists on the pull to deep square
another single to third man as the scoreboard is kept ticking...they haven't tried anything expansive in the Powerplay, just taken what's on offer
tries to angle this away to third man but some extra bounce takes it through to Ramdin
a full delivery is flicked through midwicket wide of mid on
worked from outside off through the leg side, good placement wide of long on allows a second
full on the popping crease, dug out back down the pitch and Holder gets a helping hand as the ball ricochets into de Villiers
top shot! No need for brute force, just drives a full delivery perfectly straight down the ground...he held the pose for a second. Take a nice picture of that one
comes round the wicket, full at the stumps, pushed down the ground a long on is pretty slow and can't stop a second
comes forward and it takes a thick outside edge through point for another brace
a bouncer, over middle and leg, 133kph but it's too short
back of a length outside off, worked down to third man
close! Squares him up with a length delivery, aiming to the leg side, takes a leading edge but doesn't quite carry to point
comes forward on off stump, pushes at it with an open face to backward point
another short ball, good line over middle stump, Miller sways out of the line
short of a length, touch of extra bounce and another blow for Miller
good yorker, 144kph, de Villiers drops his bat down on it
played with an open face to point
works a straight delivery to midwicket
short of a length, angled across the left hander, can't beat backward point
gets inside the line and tucks this off his body to deep square
excellent hook shot, bisects the gap to deep square leg
pushed into the covers to take him to 49
on the back foot, pushes this from outside off down to long on to take him to an excellent fifty...taking the chance to build an innings
width outside off and cut to the cover sweeper
full outside off, worked down the ground to long on
driven to the left of mid off who is inside the circle
lovely piece of placement, and awful piece of fielding...the drive beat mid-off to his left, long on was running around and tried to his foot but made a meal of it
tucks this off the stumps to deep square leg
picks out cover as he cuts
uses his feet but is then beaten by some turn and gets taken on the pad
opens the face a little and drives to keep cover
trying to use his feet, again, and Benn varying his length effectively as Miller gets taken on the pads
full and pushed down the ground
tucked away off leg stump to keep the strike
length ball at the stumps, de Villiers back to punch down to long-on
length on a straight line, whipped out to deep square
full on the off stump, de Villiers backing away to try and steer this wide of mid-off but finds the fielder
cutter, de Villiers across off stump flicking down to long-on
sliding across the left-hander who waits for it and angles out to deep cover
playing from the crease pushes a length ball to cover
tossed up on the stumps, touched out through midwicket
straight line and swept firmly off backward of square, lovely timing, brings the 100 stand up
off stump now, backs away and pushes out to deep cover
takes a shimmy down the wicket but yorks himself and dig it out back to the bowler
stays in the crease this time and drives firmly down to long-on
very full on off stump, dropped steadily into the covers for a sharp single
back punching out to deep cover
full on middle and leg, clipped firmly past midwicket but long-on is around quickly to save the second
short wide, slapped wide of deep cover for a couple
full length at the pads, calmly driven down to long-on
slower ball, played from the stumps to midwicket
full and wide outside mid-off, driven at and gets a thick outside edge that flies towards third man but short of the fielder
down the ground and smashed into the stands, big strike, back almost clearing the stand behind the bowler, a step down the wicket and then bang, lovely timing
flat delivery from over the wicket skips down leg, off Ramdin's pad inside short long leg
length on off stump, calmly knocked up the wicket
touch wider and steered wide of point
down the track, Benn fired it in, Miller adjusted easily to punch down to long-on

tossed up, swept from off stump, de Villiers missed, a huge cry for lbw, not out given but West Indies pretty quickly review. Was this outside the line? Or did it even turn too much and will miss off stump? Yep done too much, hitting umpire's call and Hawk Eye has it turning past and bouncing over off stump
fuller ball and this time de Villiers goes for the paddle, meets it on the full, and gets it very fine, nice shot

full and wide of off stump, driven at and he slices it straight to deep point. Miller was reaching for it a little, head in the air slightly and it flew straight to the fielder a few yards in from the boundary who pouched a safe catch
waited for in the crease and pushed out square on the off side
full length angled across the left-hander who lets it come on and angles down to third man
back of a length, tries to pull down the ground, high on the bat but safely down for a single to long-on
length ball a foot or so wide of off stump, carved straight to backward point
fuller length, a pleasant flowing drive out to deep cover
floated up just outside off, driven steadily down to long-off
back of a length outside off stump, slapped to deep cover
drifts down leg, Ramdin gets across to take it
back and across pushing a ball just back of a length through midwicket
straight line, de Villiers drives with an open face to extra-cover

down the track, not to the pitch of the ball at all, drags it leg side and in the air and finds long-on! A second quick breakthrough. De Villiers limping off with cramp, did injury force this stroke? A horrid hack in the end, nowhere near the desired connection and it was well held by the fielder going to his right hand side, smart catch
length on the stumps, bit of an leading edge up the wicket looking to play into the leg side
straight line, tucked down to long leg
back of a length at the body, steered away nicely backward of square, nice little pull
back of a length a foot outside off, pressed out to deep cover
just outside off, guided carefully down to third man
back foot punch into the covers, they take on the fielder running to his right and get home comfortably
nicely bowled, bounces a wee bit and Duminy is struck on the glove, ball runs to point
length ball on off stump, knocked to extra-cover
touch wider, touched behind backward point and they gets a sharp single
full at the off stump, blocked only back to the bowler
similar ball, waited for a little more and dropped in front of point for a quick single
full at the stumps, clipped wide of midwicket for one more
straighter to the leftie who tries to flick through the leg side but gets struck on the pad for a leg bye through square leg
back of a length just outside off, dropped behind point for a sharp single
straight line, clipped wide of long leg and they charge back for the second

similar delivery, this time it comes off inside edge and pad, runs up on the off side not far off the strip, Behardien is sent back looking for a quick single, Russell follows through, kicks down the stumps and runs him out! What brilliant footwork. We saw one of these in the T20s and once again superb footballing skills, left foot this time, right on target and the batsman's dive back into his ground was way short, no need for the third umpire even
forward press just outside off, gets a thick inside edge to square leg
excellent yorker, flicks this out down to long leg
waited for this back of a length ball, angled down to third man
short angled in, waited for and deflected to third man
back of a length just outside off, flicked out to midwicket
yorker, dug into midwicket, non-striker sent back, midwicket steams in and dives with a throw to the bowler's end and another direct may have created another run out
flicks this past midwicket and they can come back for the second
forward on off stump, pressed into the covers for a sharp single
length ball angled in, touched down to long leg
angled across the left-hander cut wide of third man and the fielder fumbles so they get two

bumper, Duminy goes to hook and gets a glove to the keeper! Duminy walks straight off. Excellent short ball, over middle and leg, it got big on Duminy who was late on the stroke and got a little touch on it to Ramdin who had a simple catch to take
short ball, Steyn sways inside the line, played it well
another short one, this time Steyn tries to cut and misses
very full now on off stump, driven out through cover
goes short again, right on line, Steyn under it quickly
bumper again, Steyn fends it off awkwardly, it comes off the glove onto the helmet and lands short of Ramdin
back of a length just outside off, Steyn backs away and tries to swing hard down the ground and misses completely
almost the same again, more of a cross-batted swipe at this, missed it again
yorker length at the leg stump, dug back to the bowler
another yorker, this goes past the leg stump
wide of off stump again, a big swing again, missed again

full delivery wide of off stump, swung at over the off side, gets it's high but nowhere near long enough and deep cover takes the catch! Another wicket, what a collapse this is. Philander feeling the pressure, trying to smash this away down the ground but it squirted off a thick outside edge and flew down deep cover's throat
full length at the stumps, driven back to the bowler who half-saves but they get a single down the ground
full length at the stumps, clipped straight to square leg
short ball, very badly played and it cannons off the helmet down to long leg, excellent short ball
length ball wide of off stump, Steyn tries another might heave but yet again gets thin air
low full toss on off stump, Steyn manages to lean out to it and steer it past extra-cover, much-needed boundary
around the wicket, slower ball, dabbed into the covers, they take on the fielder, direct hit could have caused trouble there
short ball, Steyn backs miles out of the way

inn2.comm: short and at the body, Dwayne Smith helps it through backward square, aerial but safe
good, probing delivery to Gayle over the top of off stump, he stays back and pokes at it, gets an low edge to slip on the bounce
touch short, on the stumps, Gayle squares up his giant frame and pushes back down the track
length ball, seams a fraction as Gayle drops his bat on leg stump, clips the outer half and rolls into the off side, Gayle's bottom hand coming off the bat

shortish and rising above Gayle's horizontal blade, too close to cut, really... and Philander thought he heard a sound. Neither de Villiers nor the umpire were of the same opinion, although Snicko picked up something faint as the ball passed the bat
slightly back of a length, clubbed over Philander's head, he sticks up a hand but doesn't get near it, runs past mid-on for a couple
starts on an off-stump line, turned short on the leg side
climbs from short of a length, hits the inside edge as Smith fends at it
speared down the leg side, Morkel thinks there might have been a flick of glove on it - trouser, I think
length in the channel, maybe a hint of movement away as Smith flails at it
width on offer and Smith gets a big stride in, carves the ball high over point, third man comes round to keep them to a couple
cracked behind square, gives fine leg no chance! Super pull shot from Smith, seized on the short ball and rifled a pull to the fence
short ball, on Gayle's ample hips and he flicks this over square leg, pinged off the middle and away to the boundary
steps to the leg side, caveman cudgel from Gayle and he batters Philander down the ground for four more through long-on

top-edged, high out towards deep backward point as Gayle tried to baseball-bat Philander down the ground again... Miller makes a superb diving effort but is inches short of getting a hand to it out by the rope
another bouncer, closer to the body this time, Gayle pulls across the line and misses
slower ball from Philander foxes Gayle as he shuffles away once again, swing and a miss
another short ball, Philander doesn't want to give Gayle anything gull, this is swivel-slapped through square leg to the man on the boundary

ungainly swipe from Gayle, results in another top edge down to towards third man, it bounces well short of the fielder though. No control on that stroke, just rocked back and threw everything at a length ball outside off
touch short and defended on the back foot over the off stump
back of a length and tapped towards mid-on from the crease, they take the single
nicely bowled, climbing past Gayle's outside edge in the channel, didn't make much of an effort to get in line
those huge forearms go windmilling through another club back down the ground, third four for Gayle, fine of mid-off
and now he clears the ropes, smashing a Morkel bouncer into the stands at deep midwicket! That went off the bat like a mortar shell
trundles in, shortish and 130kph, tucked away through square leg to bring the Gayle-Force back on strike
slower ball from Philander, does Gayle this time... he went searching for another big hit down the ground, played all around it
length outside off, this time Gayle connects, clubs one to mid-off, who's back as far as he can go
six more, carting another short ball into the leg side! This nearly takes out a camera man seated on the boundary - props to the guy, he filmed it all the way into the boards right next to him
launched! But in the end it doesn't go all that far... Gayle backed away, toe-ended a chip over mid-on, who ran back to collect it before the rope. Slower ball deprived Gayle of pace
length ball, backs away and clubs one more to the fielder now back at long-on
first ball is sharp, slightly back of a length outside off and Gayle top-edges it over de Villiers for four more! Just enough bat on it to clear the leaping keeper
touch short, tighter to the off stump, Gayle throws his hands at another meaty cut, fails to connect
full and wide, not a great ball and Gayle feasts, lashing the half-volley over point and away to the fence

got him, another wild hack and this time de Villiers pouches the edge! The storm has blown itself out, somewhat injudicious from Gayle, he'd already got the innings off to a blistering start but he kept taking on Steyn and finally falls
length ball on off stump, Johnson shows it a straight bat
slings this short and down the leg side, Johnson raises his arms out of the way
angled across the left-hander, on a good length, drawing him forwards, defended to the off side
length ball in the channel outside off, Smith goes across and steers one away from his body behind point
slightly back of a length, around middle and off, defended
short and over the stumps, again Johnson is happy to block from the crease
pushed across and Johnson is nearly caught fishing, back in the crease and swishing at the ball slanted across him

hit on the knee roll and Philander is very keen, the umpire shakes his head but South Africa immediately review... This could be sticky for Johnson, it pitched on leg stump and straightened a touch, height looks okay; there's a moment to check for the inside edge but you can see daylight. Hawk-Eye says it would have hit middle three-quarters of the way up - Johnson is a goner, S Ravi raises his finger at the second opportunity
shortish and at the body, nudged behind square for a single to get off the mark
around the wicket, Samuels stays back and defends watchfully
pushed across the right-hander, not much turn, tapped short into the off side
sliding through outside off, fullish and punched through the covers coming forwards
tossed up outside off, Smith gets out early, waits and then cuts late towards point
gives this some extra air, Smith walks out and flicks through mid-on for a single
floated up outside off, rocks back and cuts hard but finds the man at backward point
touch short, goes across and punches to cover
short and climbing over middle and leg, Smith shows it a straight bat in defence
pitched up further, skidding on around off stump, Smith leans out and deflects to backward point with an open bat face
slightly short and forcefully pulled in front of midwicket, statement shot from Smith, runs away towards wide long-on for four
full and fast, 143kph and beats Smith's flick to leg, hit on the pad but it was sliding down
back of a length in the channel, Smith steers one off the back foot down to third man
tossed up, teasing length from Duminy, Smith should be forwards but he is beaten past the outside edge playing back, skids away off de Villiers' pads for a bye
tossed up on off stump, tries to close the face, a leading edge pops to the off side, short of Duminy in his follow through
this time takes the outside edge as Smith pushes at it, skips away through slip for a couple
length ball outside off, stands tall and punches down the ground
waits in the crease and pushes through the covers
sliding on with the arm, goes back outside off and cuts, low along the ground to backward point
short but well outside off and ignored
slightly tighter line but pretty much the same delivery and left again
same ball, this time Samuels tries to flick it towards third man but misses completely
tighter line again and Samuels is swaying inside the line of this
another one outside off, Samuels watches this go by
this tails in slightly but is left once more
just back of a length outside off, forced at off the back foot, it bounces a bit and takes a thick outside edge well wide of slip but fine of third man
fuller, this nips in and takes the thigh pad
short at the body, pulled without much of a connection, lands well short of deep square
fuller again, Samuels stays leg side of quite a straight ball and plays out through cover point
full on the stumps, flicked leg side off a thick inside edge, it runs out to deep square
back of a length just outside off, Samuels has seen enough of these, this time steps away to leg to uppercut and it flies over wide third man
googly to start, waited for the turn just outside off and guides to short third man
very full on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
this drifts down the leg side and takes the keeper's pad to short long leg
off stump now, nudged up to extra-cover
forward press up into midwicket
googly, turns into the pads and this is flicked out to deep square

full on off stump, pressed to mid-off, no single available, Samuels at the non-striker's end has come a few yards out of his ground and turns to get back as a thrown comes in and hits the stumps. They're actually going to check this and oh dear, the batsman turns his back a bit as the throw comes in and doesn't get his bat back in time! Lazy work and a direct hit brings the third wicket. Awful cricket from Samuels, a gift for South Africa
length ball on off stump, nudged up to point
wider line and left alone
full length angled in, strikes the pad with Ramdin trying to turn to leg
straight line again, blocked back to the bowler
slightly straighter, worked through square leg
back of a length, knocked down towards square leg again
a little too leg side, this is tucked simply through square leg
heaved down the ground, it was a googly not really picked, thick inside edge finds long-on
low full toss on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
quicker ball, skids onto middle and leg, this is forced out to midwicket
too wide and cut, only finds point

slider again, deceives the batsman once more and this time plumb lbw! Smith back on his stumps, done by the quicker pace, he was playing all around his and struck right smack bang in front of all three, umpire Ravi gave it out immediately
over the wicket, slides one past an attempted cut
touch fuller, dabbed wide of the point this time and they get a sharp single
straight line to the leftie, tucked in front of square leg
just a touch short, Ramdin back cracking a cut out to deep cover
way down leg, swept at and missed, almost fell out of his ground
just outside off, back punching to extra-cover
more air, Carter reaches this on the full and clips out to deep midwicket
beautiful googly, not picked at all and it spins past the outside edge with Carter groping forward on off stump
quicker ball, Carter right back and pokes this to backward point from just outside off
another slider, onto the pad outside the line of leg stump
full toss this time, swept well for four backward of square
full length on off stump, ran back to the bowler
very full on off stump, dug out into the covers
swept firmly off leg stump and despite the slide from Steyn at deep-backward square it's four, really well struck, 100 up
around the wicket, pressed from middle and leg to long-on
goes to sweep off middle and leg and misses
this keeps very low outside off and skids under the attempted poke to the off side
big stride in to drive wide of cover for a sharp single
too straight and an easy tuck out through midwicket
low full tossed pressed down to long-on from middle and leg
nicely driven from off stump, great timing but straight to extra-civer
leg stump line, swept fine and beats the dive of short long leg, should have been saved
another lovely-looking drive straight to extra-cover
quicker and a yorker, dug out into the leg side
full on the stumps, clipped out to deep midwicket
full on the middle and leg stumps, inside edge into the pad looking to drive straight
wider line, reached for and dropped towards backward point, Ramdin was after a single, Carter was not
down the track and slaps this down the ground on a couple of bounces to long-on
off stump line, worked wide of long-on looking for two but only one available
nicely driven once more but this time it's cover point fielding, nice save going to his right
slider into the front pad but would have gone a long way down leg
length a foot wide of off stump, cut wide of point and a very sharp single taken
a foot wide of off stump, slides on as Carter shoulders arms
floated up more, driven back to the bowler from off stump
wider line and cut under the dive of short third man, much-needed four

nicely bowled, a googly, Carter is fooled and beaten outside off and is he stumped here? Carter tumbled forward, did he tumble out of his ground? AB de Villiers is very confident. The replay seems inconclusive as to whether anything is grounded over the line. Tough call for the third umpire but from the stump cam it doesn't look as if Carter gets any boot back. Indeed not, he's out! Lovely bit of bowling again from Tahir, the googly takes one this time. Smart stumping from de Villiers
Tahir floats this up, basically a full toss outside off, Sammy belts it to the man at cover
around the wicket, tossed up on middle and leg, worked away for a single down the ground
flatter, on the stumps, Sammy tucks it through square leg
flighted, middle-stump line, Ramdin closes the face and chips through midwicket for another single
pushed across outside off stump, slapped off the back foot but finds the point fielder
floated up and straightening a fraction on off stump, Sammy leans out and blocks
flat trajectory, in the channel, hops back and brings the arms through in a arc, chops one to deep cover
length outside off stump, goes back and stabs one through backward point
slightly short of a length, seams away as Ramdin swishes at it, fails to connect
short and wide, reaches out to crack this through the covers to the sweeper
length in the channel, 129kph, guided down to third man off the back foot
short and coming in from outside off, stays back and steers another single to third man

is anyone going to appeal for this? De Villiers turns around as he takes the catch and celebrates, Philander starts walking back... Eventually sticks up a questioning hand, at de Villiers' prompting, and umpire Ravi raises his finger. Sammy tried to cut off the back foot, got a big deflection off the shoulder of the bat... but he wasn't walking until he was told to
starts by straying to the leg side, Ramdin sits back and nudges one off his hips to fine leg
good length, snaking in and then holding its line in the channel, Russell deflects it down to third man
stays back in the crease and dabs one more to the leg side - Ramdin is accumulating by stealth out there
length ball around off stump, doesn't get up as much as Russell is expecting and he aims a woolly woof to the leg side, misses by a distance... It does de Villiers, too, who takes it on the body
slower ball in the channel, sits up over off stump and Russell slaps it hard through the covers for a much-needed boundary
shortish and at the body, goes to the leg side and pulls one more through midwicket
touch short outside off, chopped off the back foot through point
short again, over middle and leg, pulled firmly through midwicket to the fielder in the deep
oh my, that's outrageous! Slightly overpitched by Philander and Russell clears the leg, plants him into the stands at long-off... That went miles
full toss this time and Russell goes again, pumping the ball in the crowd at long-off, not quite the same distance but six more good'uns

bumper, thin edge, gottim! Russell burns brightly and briefly, as too many have for West Indies, tried hit the cover off it again, swinging wildly at a short ball outside off, totally off balance and snicks through to de Villiers
slightly short and angling away off the seam, pushes at it in the channel
again veers to the leg side, waits on the short ball and flicks behind square, Duminy does well to prevent four
little bit of width, Steyn rolled his fingers over the ball but it left Ramdin off the pitch, beat the outside edge
short and around off stump, rolls the wrists on a pull through square leg
puts it on a length around the line of off, Holder plays down the wrong line
good length, outside off, stabbed into the covers and Holder pinches one
touch short, drops back and guides one to third man
pushed through, Ramdin works the ball into a gap at midwicket and comes charging back for two
tossed up outside off, skidding on and chopped into the ground, Tahir fields in his follow through
flat and sliding towards middle and leg, pulled via bat and some pad behind square
on the stumps, Holder works the ball to the leg side
floated up, full outside off, Ramdin goes down on one knee and proposes the ball head out towards deep midwicket, which it does, beating the fielder in the deep

tossed up a little straighter, Ramdin tries to heave to leg again, this straightens and clatters the stumps! Ramdin is done, played his slog-sweep over the top of the ball. Tahir does a baby-rocking celebration toward the stands
dug in and rising to hit Holder on the body as he stays leg side
bouncer, Taylor has a swipe at it, doesn't connect... or does  he? De Villiers asks to review. Nothing on Snicko or the audio, so we'll carry on, gentlemen
banged in again, Taylor takes it on and this time wears the blow on his shoulder
back of a length outside off, backs away and throws the bat, misses
Taylor hacks across the line against another bumper, top-edges the ball high over the keeper, fine leg runs around to collect
135kph bouncer, at Taylor's bonce, he nods underneath it this time
length ball, another giddy swing, top-edged high, high, high into the sky... and David Miller takes an excellent catch back-pedalling in the covers. South Africa are almost home and hosed
there it is, dabs in the channel and nicks through to de Villiers! Steyn started the wicket-taking and he finishes it with two in two to give South Africa a 61-run win (D/L method)
